posts.cooked: Hello! I’m new to this side of the robotics scene and was wondering where to start from for design inspiration and stuff of that sort. My team uses solidworks to design.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: It's time for Jack to let 'er rip!

posts.custom_user_title: It's time for Jack to let 'er rip!

posts.name: Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)
posts.cooked:
A lot of shooting anything comes down to a few things:

The target. Horizontal opening? Vertical? How big relative to the game piece? Is there a backboard?

The game piece.  Ball? Disc? Something else? Does it compress? Will the compression change as the game piece wears (like the foam-skinned balls of 2012/2020)? What’s the inflation tolerance, if inflated?  Does a longer acceleration time help shot consistency?

The game rules. How many game pieces can you hold (and, presumably, shoot)?  Is there a spot that’s more advantageous, either for a shorter cycle distance or for protection from defense? Do other field elements or robot rules impact how you could fit a system to line up multiple game pieces in your robot?

You can design a couple wheels to make a pitching machine easy, but the devil is in the details.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: says you should come to SCRIW in October

posts.custom_user_title: says you should come to SCRIW in October

posts.name: Joash
posts.cooked:
I would consider looking back at recent games such as 2022 Rapid React (Ball) and 2024 Cresendo (Ring) robots

Some Onshape Examples:

2910 (2024)

1678 (2024)

1678 (2022)

Check out frcdesign’s shooter library here , has a bunch of examples. Also 3847’s cad library here has lots of complete robots, just look at years with shooters (2024, 2022, 2020, 2017, 2013, etc.). If you want actual teaching, FRCdesign’s stage 2A is a shooter build, though it is not specifically tailored to solidworks, the concepts are there.

posts.name: Espino
posts.cooked: You should check NASA RAP document , it has great examples of mechanisms and everything related to ways of building a robot. With that and checking recent examples you will have a great idea of how to do it.
